sponsor.partnerMessage: Play an essential role in the health care field by becoming a registered nurse. NWACC‚Äôs accredited nursing program offers short-term, high-impact training with state-of-the-art technology and can move you into a new career in as little as 14 months.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday, everyone! Here are a few exciting things happening in Northwest Arkansas this weekend:

  • üé£ Gone fishin': Drop a line this weekend during the Arkansas Game and Fish Commission's annual free fishing weekend, and fish anywhere in Arkansas without a fishing license or trout permit from noon on Friday, Jun 9, until midnight on Jun 11.
  • üê£ Cluckin' good time: Strut down the Chicken Strip during the 63rd Annual Poultry Festival at the Rogers Convention Center from Jun 9-10.
  • üëó Strut your stuff: NWA Fashion Week continues at the Momentary with the second runway show on Friday, June 9, and the final showcase on Saturday, Jun 10, followed by a free afterparty with music by Yuni Wa at the Momentary Tower Bar from 10p-12a.
  • ü•∑ Ninja warriors: Let the kids loose to run and ninja warrior-climb their way through the Young Lions Obstacle Course NWA 2023 on Saturday, Jun 10, from 9a-1p at JB Hunt Park in Springdale.
  • ü¶á Holy toledo, Batman: Devil's Den State Park will host the 33rd Annual Bat-A-Rama this weekend, celebrating the importance of bats who live in the park's cave systems from Jun 9-11.
  • üíÉ Girl party: Hear ten vibrant DJs and musical acts, shop over 20 businesses and local artists, dress to impress, and dance the night away during the Her Set Her Sound Festival in Fayetteville this weekend, Jun 10-11.
  • üö£ Cardboat: Ozark Beer Co will host its 3rd Annual Ozark Cardboard Boat Regatta this weekend with a Boat Building & Inspection on Saturday, Jun 10, from 6-8:30p at the brewery and the cardboard boat races at Lake Atalanta on Sunday, Jun 11, at 1p.
  • üèåÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Fore! The Benton County Sheriff's Cup Cocktail Event and Golf Tournament are back for the 3rd year, with a cocktail party on Sunday, Jun 11, before the tournament kicks off Monday, Jun 12.

Enjoy your weekend, Northwest Arkansas!

posts.title: Second Year of Creative Exchange Fund to Launch in Springdale
posts.content:
Applications for the second year of the Creative Exchange Fund (CXF) by CACHE will be open from Jun 12 - July 17, offering five unique opportunities for local artists to advance their creative work through funding and professional development at the Medium in Downtown Springdale.

  • Advancing art: CXF is designed to support Northwest Arkansas artists and creatives by providing funding, access to space, and professional development resources. Overall, CXF will support the creation of over 30 art activations in 2023-2024.
  • Taking part: Practicing creatives, artists, non-profits, and for-profit creative collectives are eligible to apply for CXF funds. A general information session will be hosted online on Jun 15 at 6p, and an in-person tour of The Medium will be hosted on Jun 24 at 10:30a.

Learn more about the Creative Exchange Fund HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Listed Among America's Prettiest Small Towns
posts.content:
Eureka Springs was included in the AARP's recent list of the 27 Prettiest American Small Towns across the country.

  • Artists' Oasis: Founded in 1879, Eureka Springs has a long history as a destination for tourists visiting the Northwest Arkansas region with its stunning Ozark scenery and its vibrant arts culture ‚Äî more than 300 working artists call this resort-town home.
  • Explore: Eureka Springs hosts several music festivals each year, drawing musicians from all over the country, and is home to several attractions like the acclaimed Opera of the Ozarks, Turpentine Creek Wildlife Refuge, Onyx Show Cave, the historic Cresent Hotel, and the iconic 65-ft modernist statue Christ of the Ozarks.

See what other American Small Towns made the list HERE.

posts.title: University of Arkansas Ranks High In Value Of MBA Program
posts.content:
A recent study by The Wall Street Journal ranked Walton College of Business at the U of A 11th out of 600 programs regarding return on investment in earning an MBA.

  • Value added: Walton MBA students borrow an average of $28K for the program and earn an average of $106K two years later, resulting in a debt-to-income ratio of 0.26, and considering the cost of living in NWA makes that advantage even more remarkable.
  • Get ahead: With an innovative curriculum taught by world-renowned faculty and unparalleled networking opportunities through corporate connections in the region, Walton College provides opportunities for full-time MBA students as well as opportunities for working professionals to further their education.

Learn more about Walton College of Business HERE.

posts.title: Cool Jobs In NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out the wide range of positions posted to our community board:

  • Ox, the Human Centered Automation Company, is looking for a Financial Analyst to join their team. for their high-end charcuterie service.
  • Join Canopy NWA as a Refugee Services Intern through the summer and fall.
  • Find several other listings in the Health, Education, and Retail industries.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it HERE.
